head.title: Clemens and the Bat: The Wrong Lesson

hedline.hl1: Clemens and the Bat: The Wrong Lesson

abstract.p: Karen Manasse letter says she was horried when Yankee pitcher Roger Clemens threw bat at Mets' Mike Piazza; questions why there were no consequences to Clemens's act

block.p: Re ''Clemens Throws a Bat, Then Dominates the Mets'' (front page, Oct. 23): As an avid Yankee fan, I enthusiastically sat down to watch Game 2 of the Subway Series. I was horrified when Roger Clemens, the Yankees' pitcher, threw a bat at the Mets' Mike Piazza. I was dumbfounded when Clemens was not ejected from the game, and found myself in the uncomfortable position of rooting for the Yankees and against Clemens.

Re ''Clemens Throws a Bat, Then Dominates the Mets'' (front page, Oct. 23): As an avid Yankee fan, I enthusiastically sat down to watch Game 2 of the Subway Series. I was horrified when Roger Clemens, the Yankees' pitcher, threw a bat at the Mets' Mike Piazza. I was dumbfounded when Clemens was not ejected from the game, and found myself in the uncomfortable position of rooting for the Yankees and against Clemens.

When I arrived at work today at an alternative junior high school on the Lower East Side, I found the students excitedly discussing Clemens's behavior. As a social worker, I work with children on many issues, including anger management. We teach our students that if you retaliate, you are equally guilty -- of fighting, of throwing crayons and so on. We help our students find words to express their feelings.
So why is a future Hall of Fame pitcher allowed to instigate a fight on the biggest baseball stage without any consequences?
